intro: Veprecella apiculata, commonly known as the apiculate veprecella, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed structure that splits open to release tiny seeds. Veprecella apiculata is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
